item.title: Shan Masood, Babar Azam register new record for Pakistan against South Africa - The Times of India
item.description:
Shan Masood and Babar Azam Set New Record for Pakistan Against South Africa

Published on: October 2023, Source: Times of India

In an impressive display of cricket, Shan Masood and Babar Azam have made history by registering a new record for Pakistan in their match against South Africa.

  • Masood scored a remarkable century, leading the team to a commanding position.
  • Babar Azam's partnership with Masood proved crucial in the match.
  • This victory reinforces Pakistan's standing in international cricket.
“This record is a testament to our hard work and dedication,” said Babar Azam after the match.

The achievement not only adds to the team's accolades but also boosts morale ahead of upcoming matches.

item.title: 'Reset, avoid on-field battles': AB de Villiers offers Virat Kohli key advice - The Times of India
item.description:
AB de Villiers offers Virat Kohli key advice

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Following a challenging tour of Australia, AB de Villiers has shared critical advice with his friend Virat Kohli, who faced difficulties in his batting performance, particularly against deliveries outside off-stump, leading to India's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Kohli struggled with his form in the recent series, scoring only 190 runs over nine innings.
  • His performance included an average of 23.75, with a single century in the first Test.
  • De Villiers highlighted the need for Kohli to reset his mindset and avoid on-field battles during tough times.
  • Kohli's significant challenges in the ongoing 2024-25 Test season were also discussed, where he has only managed 382 runs in 10 matches.
  • De Villiers acknowledged Kohli's fighting spirit but urged him to refocus after every ball.
“...it is best to get rid of those things. As a batter, it is to reset every single and realize every ball is an event and just forget about the bowler.” - AB de Villiers

In conclusion, AB de Villiers believes that a mental reset will be crucial for Kohli to regain his form and contribute effectively to the team.

item.title: Chess King Magnus Carlsen Marries His Queen Ella Victoria - Chess.com
item.description:
Chess King Magnus Carlsen Marries His Queen Ella Victoria

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Chess.com

Magnus Carlsen has married Ella Victoria Malone in a beautiful ceremony held at Holmenkollen Chapel in Oslo, attended by close family and friends.

  • The couple exchanged vows in a snowy setting on a sunny winter day.
  • The lavish reception took place at the iconic Grand Hotel in Oslo.
  • Notable guests included Carlsen's best men and prominent figures from the chess community.
  • A film crew from Netflix attended, possibly filming for a upcoming chess-related show.
  • Ella Victoria Carlsen has been transitioning into a more public role, attending various chess events with Carlsen.

“Sometimes it's difficult to come with him to these tournaments, but I do it anyway because I want to be a good girlfriend and support him, and it's something I'm getting used to.”
—Ella Victoria Malone

This marriage signifies a new chapter in both their lives, with Ella expected to play a more central role in Magnus' career.

item.title: Amid Retirement Claims, Virat Kohli Gets Brutal Reality Check: "Even Sachin Tendulkar..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Virat Kohli Faces Criticism Following India's Defeat in Sydney Test

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team suffered a significant loss against Australia, raising questions about senior player Virat Kohli’s performance. Irfan Pathan criticized Kohli’s batting average, suggesting that a new player could contribute equally.

  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and its chance to qualify for the World Test Championship final.
  • Irfan Pathan highlighted Kohli's struggles, averaging only 15 in 2024's first innings.
  • Pathan called for a shift from 'superstar culture' to a more team-focused approach in Indian cricket.
  • Jasprit Bumrah noted that the young players gained valuable experience despite the setback.
“We are not degrading Virat Kohli... it takes hard work to rectify that mistake.” - Irfan Pathan

The critical response aimed at Kohli emphasizes the need for accountability and performance in high-stakes sports.

item.title: Virat Kohli receives massive retirement verdict from ‘sad’ Pat Cummins: ‘Bit of theatre, sometimes it can rile you up’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Pat Cummins Reflects on Virat Kohli's Potential Retirement

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Australia's skipper Pat Cummins praised India’s Virat Kohli, expressing sadness over the possibility of it being Kohli's last series. He noted the competitive nature of their contests and highlighted Kohli's theatrical presence in cricket.

  • India lost the fifth Test against Australia, concluding the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series 1-3.
  • Kohli managed to score 190 runs in the series, with a notable century in the first Test.
  • Pat Cummins mentioned the emotional impact Kohli has had on the game and acknowledged his significant career.
  • There are discussions among fans regarding the future of both Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the Indian Test team.
“It will be sad if it’s his last series,” said Pat Cummins regarding Virat Kohli.

The reflections on Kohli's potential retirement have sparked discussions within the cricket community about his legacy and future in the sport.

item.title: India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections - The Indian Express
item.description:
India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Indian Express

India suffered a 1-3 defeat against Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, mainly due to inconsistent batting performances while Jasprit Bumrah's bowling was exceptional, ending the series with 32 wickets.

  • Bumrah's remarkable performance was overshadowed by India's poor batting average of 24.67 compared to Australia's 28.79.
  • India's batting failures included lack of significant contributions from key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal stood out as India's best batter with 391 runs.
  • Questions were raised over team selection, particularly the choice of spinners on a green pitch.
  • Australia made fewer errors, clinching the trophy they hadn't held for eight years.
“It is just a different ball game, a different planet, that Bumrah is playing on compared to everyone else.” - Adam Gilchrist

India's shortcomings both in batting consistency and strategic decisions ultimately led to their defeat in the prestigious Border Gavaskar Trophy series.

item.title: Saim Ayub to travel to London for ankle fracture treatment - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Saim Ayub to travel to London for ankle fracture treatment

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: ESPNcricinfo

Pakistan opener Saim Ayub is set to undergo treatment in London for an ankle fracture sustained during a Test match in Cape Town. The decision by the PCB to expedite his treatment comes amid past criticisms of their handling of player injuries.

  • Saim Ayub suffered an ankle injury during the second Test against South Africa.
  • The PCB has sent him to London for immediate specialist treatment instead of waiting for the end of the Test.
  • Assistant coach Azhar Mahood will accompany Ayub on his journey.
  • PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi assured that Ayub will receive care at a top hospital.
  • Ayub is expected to miss six weeks of play, risking his participation in the upcoming Champions Trophy.
"All resources will be used for his treatment." - PCB statement

This incident illustrates the PCB's commitment to improving their approach to player injuries, aiming for a more proactive and immediate response to such situations.

item.title: 'A bit of theatre': Pat Cummins praises Virat Kohli for adding drama to rivalry - The Times of India
item.description:
'A bit of theatre': Pat Cummins praises Virat Kohli for adding drama to rivalry

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

After a victorious match in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy final, Australian captain Pat Cummins commended Virat Kohli for his performances and the dramatic element he brings to their rivalry.

  • Pat Cummins praised Kohli's contributions to the game and noted the excitement his presence brings.
  • Cummins mentioned that competition against Kohli has always felt like theatre, contributing to the game's drama.
  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series to Australia after a decade with a final score of 1-3.
  • Kohli had a challenging series, finishing with 190 runs in nine innings, including one century.
“It’s always been a wonderful contest. Yeah, I think more than just the runs that he brings to the game, it’s always a bit about a theatre...” - Pat Cummins

Overall, Cummins expressed that Kohli's presence in cricket is significant, and it would be disappointing if this series marked the end of his career.

item.title: Virat Kohli Wants To Play 2027 World Cup, In ‘No Mood To Retire’: Report - News18
item.description:
Virat Kohli Aims for 2027 World Cup, Postpones Retirement Plans

Date: January 05, 2025 Source: News18

Virat Kohli is not contemplating retirement despite a challenging year in international cricket. He aims to participate in the 2027 ODI World Cup set to be held in Africa.

  • Kohli had a disappointing 2024, scoring only one century in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Questions arise about his and Rohit Sharma's future in international cricket following poor performances.
  • Selectors may find it difficult to choose Kohli based solely on IPL performances without recent red-ball cricket experience.
  • Kohli last played domestic red-ball cricket in 2012, while Rohit last played in 2015.
  • Head coach Gautam Gambhir indicates it is up to Kohli and Rohit to decide their futures.
“Would be very hard for selectors to pick either Rohit Sharma or Virat Kohli on the basis of IPL performance or form.”

In conclusion, although Kohli's recent form raises concerns, his determination to continue playing suggests he is still a key figure for the Indian cricket team moving forward.

item.title: Manjrekar sends clear message to Agarkar regarding Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli: ‘How long to play, is upto selectors’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Manjrekar sends clear message to Agarkar regarding Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli: ‘How long to play, is upto selectors’

Date: Jan 05, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian cricket team suffered a defeat against Australia in the fifth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, raising questions about the futures of senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. The critic Sanjay Manjrekar addressed these concerns, emphasizing the role of selectors in deciding player longevity.

  • India lost the fifth and final Test against Australia, resulting in a 1-3 series defeat.
  • Controversies surrounded key players, with Virat Kohli's behavior and R Ashwin's retirement making headlines.
  • Rohit Sharma's poor form led to widespread speculation about his future in Test cricket.
  • Manjrekar stated, “When to retire, is upto the player but how long to play, is upto the selectors.”
“I am confident things will change. At the same time, I have to be realistic as well.” - Rohit Sharma

The future of both Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli remains uncertain as performance discussions continue, alongside calls for more accountability from the selectors.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: We need players like Yashasvi Jaiswal, Nitish Reddy who protect their wicket like life: Sunil Gavaskar - The Times of India
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Calls for Committed Young Players Post India’s Border-Gavaskar Trophy Loss

Publication Date: January 5, 2023

Source: Times of India

Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar analyzed India's recent loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, emphasizing the need for players like Yashasvi Jaiswal and Nitish Reddy who show commitment and protect their wicket seriously.

  • Gavaskar suggested that motivated young players are essential for India's cricket future.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal scored a total of 391 runs in five Tests, including a 161 in Perth.
  • Nitish Reddy contributed 298 runs in his debut series with a maiden Test century.
  • Gavaskar questioned player commitment and participation in the upcoming Ranji Trophy matches amidst ongoing T20 series.
  • He stressed India's batting deficiencies and the importance of application in Test cricket.
  • Gavaskar identified technical deficiencies contributing to India's struggles in recent Test series.
  • He called for readiness for the next World Test Championship cycle, starting in June.
“You need such players who will protect their wicket like their life. You need such players.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar's insights reveal a call for rejuvenation and commitment within the Indian cricket team as they prepare for future challenges.

item.title: Stuart Broad’s old ‘Australia start to fight and moan’ comment emerges after Konstas-Bumrah episode reaches fever pitch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Stuart Broad's old comment of ‘Australia start to fight and moan’ is going viral amid the Sam Konstas-Jasprit Bumrah episode in the Sydney Test.

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy series between India and Australia may have concluded with Australia winning 3-1, but the conflict between Sam Konstas and Jasprit Bumrah during the first day at the Sydney Cricket Ground continues to garner attention following sharp remarks from India coach Gautam Gambhir.

  • The incident has escalated with Andrew McDonald accusing India of intimidating Konstas.
  • Bumrah confronted Konstas after he attempted to provoke him before the close of play.
  • Gautam Gambhir suggested that McDonald's claims of intimidation were unfounded.

What did Stuart Broad say?

"Just from the outside, it looks like Australia have started a lot of fights and then [are] moaning when someone comes back." - Stuart Broad

This comment resurfaced during the ongoing controversy, initially stemming from Broad's remarks during a 2018 press conference regarding Australia's behavior in cricket.

The situation reflects ongoing tensions in cricket and the dynamics between players from different teams.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Dark clouds hover over Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's Test future - The Times of India
item.description:
Concerns Rise Over the Test Careers of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma

Publication Date: N/A
Source: Times of India

As Team India faces a disappointing performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, questions emerge about the future of star players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in Test cricket, particularly after their struggles and growing calls for a transition to new talent.

  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 1-3 to Australia, marking a significant defeat.
  • Virat Kohli's recent struggles include scoring just 190 runs in the series, with a notable performance limited to two innings.
  • Kohli's Test average has seen a stark decline, with many speculating about the future of his career.
  • Rohit Sharma's form has also dwindled, managing only 31 runs in three matches during the series.
  • Calls for both players to step aside for upcoming talent are growing louder among fans and analysts.
“Tell me one thing. When last did Virat Kohli play domestic cricket… It’s been so long...” - Irfan Pathan

The future of Kohli and Rohit in Test cricket is now uncertain as both legends of the game face critical challenges and mounting pressure to allow the next generation to take the helm.

item.title: Ponting on Bumrah: "Probably the best series of fast bowling I've ever seen" - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Ponting on Bumrah: "Probably the best series of fast bowling I've ever seen"

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

No doubt, it's probably the best series of fast bowling I've ever seen. Yes, they had good conditions, the fast bowlers, for most of this series. But when you watched him (Bumrah) bowl compared to anyone else in the series, he made batting look so much harder,” Ponting said.

  • Ponting emphasizes Bumrah's dominating performance in the series.
  • He noted the quality of the Australian batting line-up but highlighted Bumrah's ability to make them look ineffective.
“There's a lot of quality batting in that Australian top-order as well but he made all of them at different times look silly,” Ponting added.

Ponting's comments underscore the exceptional skill displayed by Bumrah throughout the series, making a significant impact on the matches.

item.title: Virat Kohli does not deserve place in team, need to end superstar culture: Irfan Pathan - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Irfan Pathan Critiques Virat Kohli's Place in the Indian Team

Published on: 05 January 2025, 09:45 IST

Former cricketer Irfan Pathan has openly criticized Virat Kohli, questioning his commitment to the Indian cricket team and suggesting he does not deserve a place in the squad due to a lack of form and effort in domestic cricket.

  • Pathan urges an end to the 'superstar culture' in Indian cricket.
  • Kohli's performance in the recent Test series against Australia was subpar, scoring only 190 runs over nine innings.
  • Pathan notes that Kohli has not played domestic cricket in over a decade.
  • He suggests that Kohli's underwhelming averages warrant replacing him with a younger player.
  • The critiques stem from Kohli's inability to correct technical flaws in his game.
"For the Indian team in 2024, in the first innings where you basically set up the match, Virat Kohli’s average is 15. And if you consider his average over the last five years, it's not even 30." - Irfan Pathan

Australia defeated India by six wickets in the fifth Test, regaining the Border Gavaskar trophy amidst criticisms directed at the senior players.

item.title: "Retirement In Your Hands, Playing For India Is Not": Rohit Sharma Served Big Warning - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Retirement In Your Hands, Playing For India Is Not: Rohit Sharma Served Big Warning

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: NDTV Sports

In a recent interview, Rohit Sharma discussed his cricketing future amid speculations of his retirement, clarifying that while retirement is a personal decision, his place in the team will ultimately be determined by the selectors.

  • Sanjay Manjrekar emphasizes that while players can decide on retirement, performance determines team selection.
  • Rohit has opted out of the latest Test match due to poor form and expresses that he won't retire soon.
  • Manjrekar notes the impact of selectors' choices on players' careers, highlighting a respect for hierarchy in the selection process.
“Retirement is in your hands, but playing for India is not,” Sanjay Manjrekar stated.

The conversation sheds light on the balancing act of personal ambitions versus team requirements in professional sports.

item.title: How India failed to register a hat-trick of Border-Gavaskar Trophy series wins in Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
How India failed to register a hat-trick of Border-Gavaskar Trophy series wins in Australia

Publication Date: New Delhi | Source: Times of India

India faced significant challenges in their pursuit to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, leading to their defeat in the recent series against Australia.

  • India lost the series 1-3 to Australia, failing to surpass 200 runs in multiple innings.
  • Rohit Sharma's captaincy faced scrutiny following inconsistent performances from key players.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's absence in the crucial final Test impacted India's bowling attack.
  • Virat Kohli's performance was below par, raising concerns about his form in critical matches.
  • Travis Head and Steve Smith's exceptional performances were pivotal in Australia's success.
“It was really frustrating, but sometimes you have to respect your body—you can’t fight it.” - Jasprit Bumrah

The series highlighted India's batting frailties and raised questions about their potential for future competitions as they missed a chance to qualify for the World Test Championship final.

item.title: Rohit To Lead; Shami Returns, No Jaiswal And Samson: India's Likely Squad For Champions Trophy 2025 - Times Now
item.description:
India's Likely Squad for Champions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma to Lead, Shami Returns

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: Times Now

India is set to name their Champions Trophy squad by January 12, with Rohit Sharma expected to continue as captain despite his current form issues.

  • The squad announcement is imminent, happening within a week.
  • Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are anticipated to retain their positions despite recent performances.
  • India is scheduled to play three ODIs against England in February after the squad announcement.
"12th January is the deadline to announce the squad. India will play their first match in the tournament against Bangladesh on February 20."

In conclusion, India's upcoming squad selection presents both challenges and opportunities as they prepare for the 2025 Champions Trophy, aiming for success on the international stage.

item.title: I was just getting Bumrah'd: Usman Khawaja - The Times of India
item.description:
Khawaja Acknowledges Bumrah as Toughest Bowler in BGT Series

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

Usman Khawaja labels Jasprit Bumrah as the most challenging bowler he has faced during the Border Gavaskar Trophy series. Khawaja expressed relief at Bumrah's absence due to injury during Australia's run chase.

  • Usman Khawaja admits he was 'just getting Bumrah'd' during the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Despite being injured, Bumrah was a dominant force in the series, claiming 32 wickets.
  • Khawaja states Bumrah is the toughest bowler he has ever faced.
  • Travis Head also expresses relief at not facing Bumrah during their match-winning innings.
“I was just getting Bumrah'd,” said Khawaja after the match.

The absence of Bumrah provided Australia a crucial advantage, allowing them to secure a win in the series finale.
